reviews.text: I purchased my OnePlus6T on December 12 -- and the power button and volume up/down buttons do not work.  I have to call my phone to 'wake' it up.  I've been chatting with OnePlus on line and the warranty is good to the party who purchased the phone from them.  It appears they are willing to work with me to get it repaired but I will have to send it to them -- not sure where yet.  I am in Alaska so would be without my phone for some period of time -- one, two, three?? Who knows.  And the phone is less than two months' old!!  I had the 5T and no problems for a year.

reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
reviews.text: I was so excited to try OnePlus. I had big hopes for this phone, but sadly it has been a disappointment from day 1.  It first started with the OneSwitch app that's supposed to help migrate your data and files. Didn't work the first time, froze, and I had to restart. But it's ok, I was ready to forgive. Things happen. However, multiple small but really annoying glitches started to come to my attention. First, the wifi connection. After saving the wifi networks I connect at work and at home, I started to realize that when I get to work or when I get back home the phone would not connect automatically and show an interrogation mark in the status bar. To work around that, I had to turn off and turn on the wifi each time in order to properly connect. Annoying right? Customer support told me to wipe my cache, which eventually helped. But man, seriously it felt like having to work my way around Windows XP while I had in hand, supposedly, the latest tech. Second glitch, oh god the most annoying. The screen locks itself at random times for no reason. Imagine to be in the middle of typing a text, browsing online, or worst shooting a video and boom! Magically screen turns black and you have to unlock it to resume what you were doing. I have reported this to OnePlus support. One of their multiple "John Smith" or  other "Philip Smith" told me to hard reset the phone. Basically go through the process of backing up all of my data, wiping the phone, and reinstalling everything. Is this called "support"??? I complained, but another Mr Smith insisted, you need to hard reset. I did, and ah! The issue is still happening. So at this time all of what OnePlus is offering, since they refused me to return this faulty device to get a refund, is to get it repaired. Shipping my phone to them pauses multiple concerns: 1/ I need to wipe my data, I don't want anyone to access it - which means annoyance again. 2/ I will have NO phone for the entire time of the repair. 3/ I have no guarantee that they will successfully repair it since the repair form only allows for 200 characters - not enough to describe all the issues I have. Because hey, I'm not done with glitches. Let's add to the list: when shooting a video, the white balance and exposure varies from a second to another. Meaning that if you are shooting a moving person, or scene, the brightness and color temperature will flicker in the most unpleasant way.  Same with the photos - change the angle slightly and the result will change dramatically - so forget about consistency of exposure and color throughout an event you are shooting. I thought OnePlus had a good camera - well not at all. Another glitch that started today: my phone is on silent, all volume down, even the media output. But, magic again, when I send a text I hear the "swoosh" sound notification of the message being sent . But whyyyyy?? I can't stand it anymore. Now I hope I can get it repaired and sell it to someone asap. Anyone interested?
reviews.title: Waste of money. Full of annoying glitches. Lack of customer support.
